title: Battlecast Illaoi is flawed. Imperfect. Incorrect.
body:
Battlecast skins are creatures turned machines that work FOR Viktor.

_You can't call her a battlecast while keeping her useless fleshy bits, and saying she's fighting against the battlecasts._

I'm down for a TRUE battlecast illaoi, but as she is now she's flawed. Imperfect. Incorrect.

{{sticker:sg-ahri-3}}

Sure, the skin is cool, the idea is in the right place, but call her something else if you keep the design, or complete the design if you keep the name.

replies.body:
Ohai!

Yeah I agree the name needs some work, but this is basically how we work internally. This name or "resistance" Illaoi is just how we refer to that concept, with absolute plans to give it an official, awesome name before we ship. Feel free to throw out ideas for naming these too peeperinos! IF this one wins I kinda like the name "Iron Resistance Illaoi" or something like that. I dunno, I draw pictures ;)

Seems like a bunch of people like Dread Nova.
The skin actually looks more like Dread Nova than Battlecast, as all of those are fully metal.
The skin is called battlecast,because it is linked with the battlecast storyline.
Some have suggested that since she's in opposition to Creator Victor her name should reflect that. Something like Destructor, Destroyer, or Decommissioner Illaoi
I do like Decommissioner

I know where you are coming from, since Jayce and Viktor are rivals in lore.
However, skins don't necessarily reflect canon lore and therefore they could give the position of the leader to another champion as well.

well according to the wiki Jayce's Resistance is a thing in "The Evolution" skin line (Battlecast  + Creator). So i figured this gave them a chance to expand on the skinline in the same way as Project/Mecha: with an opposing faction.
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/The_Evolution

This would make the whole Battlecast/Project/Mecha alternate univers more interesting.
Just do a tie-in and name her Illaoi Forces.
"Destructor Illaoi" could be a nice contrast to Creator Viktor.

I personally think Destroyer sounds better, since create/destroy are usually used in antonyms of each-other. But either way, as long as either the lore changes, the name changes, or the skin changes, it just needs to be dealt with.
I think Destroyer is too similar to World Destroyer skin line. Destructor sounds more like destroying structures, though.

Did you not read the the whole post? 

"Every two weeks we’ll post our progress to Nexus—and get your reactions and input.
You have until 23:59 PST on November 13th to vote!
Here are the concepts! These names aren’t final. None of this is final."

Thats an incorrect statement. Remember not all the PROJECT skins are on the same side. Mecha Zero Sion and Mecha Rengar are clearly against the other mechas. 

Also, Super Galaxy Elise is EVIL. Skins can be for worlds as a whole as theyve shown. One on the opposing side makes sense in that regard.

Project: Cyber + mechanically enhanced people (so far) who either accepted it and sided with their creators or decided that it's not ok.
Mecha: A bunch of robots who AFAIK are all on the same side except for Sion who's been corrupted by Creator Viktor.
Battlecast: A bunch of creatures/beings that had their flesh replaced by mechanical parts as part of the Glorious Evolution. 


All 3 factions exist in the same Universe. While Mecha and Project have rogue units they still fulfill the requirements. Battlecast Require's you to be fully rebuild. BC Illaoi in her current state is a grittier version of a Project Illaoi, she's enhanced not rebuild. 
The Battlecast lore does include Jayce's resistance, Resistance Illaoi would make sense that way. (the caitlyn skin could simply have it's background swapped for a dystopian future city as it's not that out of place)


- The wiki also refers to it as the "The Evolution" skinline, for clarity reasons i will not -

Yes, but PROJECT and MECHA skins are fully fleshed out, not half-formed. They're made by unknown creators, or a group of creators.

Mecha skins are designed by Yordle Scientists, fully built robots from the ground up.

PROJECT Skins seem to be cyberpunk future warrior sets, with unspecified creators.

Viktor _made_ BATTLECAST. They're his, no one elses. You call yourself a BATTLECAST, you are one of Viktors creations. You are against Viktor, you do not call yourself a BATTLECAST.
They said things are subject to change based on community input so I imagine she could be called Creator Illaoi, and be a creator like Viktor.

Frankly she should either be all machine and true battle cast, or she needs a different name AND a change in color palette to be more separate from the Battle cast. 

Personally I'm not a fan of the hand tentacle and would greatly prefer those greys and reds on an Infernal skin for her.

Of the three shown, I like Deep Space best.
I also voted for deep space, simply to keep this abomination from getting through as is.

Maybe it was her escaping the place where viktor turns the living into artificial? She could have just gotten out before she went full robo. We dont know the full lore of it all so why judge it because its not like the other skins in line? She could be a defect or something

Yes, that is entirely possible.

But why would you still call yourself by the name of BATTLECAST, a series of robots following Viktor's orders, if you're fighting against VIKTOR, and his army of, BATTLECASTS.

Battlecast is Viktor's design and army. Hence why there are various replies scattered through this page with ideas for new names, such as (Battlecast) Survivor Illaoi.

Skin concept is cool, but it can't go hand-in-hand with the name.

Either the name has to be changed, or the skin has to be made full battlecast. Without one of those, she does not fit with the BATTLECAST theme.

That's the best descriptions of my feelings regarding that skin I've seen so far.

Good.

"Possible emotion detected. Purging database."

-Cho'gath Prime

Thats the entire point of the skin though.
Illaoi is a battlecast who ran away before she could be completed.

And lets be honest here.
She does make a lot of sense as an enemy of creator Viktor.
I mean she serves the goddess of life and fights undead in the regular lore.
So it'd make sense for her to be an enemy of someone who wants to turn people into lifeless machines.

That's perfectly fine, but you don't refer to yourself as BATTLECAST if you're fighting against the BATTLECASTS.

You could call her Unfinished, (Battlecast) Survivor, Imperfect, Destroyer, but not the very machine's she's fighting against.

You don't refer to yourself as a member of something you're fighting against.
it's definately better than the other 2 illaoi skins

######Supporting what you like helps a lot more than trashing what you don't like.

Battlecast survivor Illaoi maybe.

Totally okay too. Opens up for a whole line of cyborg-esque skins. Whereas Destroyer Illaoi would seem to be more of the sole fighter, Survivor would imply there may be more.

I think she looks like a mechanic fucking around with viktors failed creations. 

I'd be down for a hextech illaoi skin though, or something like that. An alternate universe where she went to piltover and became a mechanic, maybe doing miscellaneous tasks for people like heimer or did some repairwork on blitzcrank once, who knows. She has the right kind of build for it, take the skin as is, change the colorings from battlecast to piltover/hextech, change the idol to some sort of conglomeration of machinery/technology or heck maybe even a toolbox, make the arms maybe less wire-y and more, idk how to describe it, but more rigid with an actual elbow/joint and you pretty much have a decent Hextech Mechanic Illaoi skin.

And thus my vote for space was cast.
The other one seemed too similar to her base look.
Maybe her and Viktor are partners? Creator Illaoi sounds cool
Viktor wouldn't accept a half-assed transformation. Creator Viktor is fully mechanical as well I believe, or at least hides his remaining humanity.
